p: Microscopy, culture and sensitivity for bacteria should be performed on all CSF samples. Antigen detection may also be helpful [ 10]. Testing for Mycobacterium tuberculosis should always be considered in endemic areas and in immunocompromised patients [ 10]. Specific virological studies on CSF depend mainly on epidemiology. It is advisable to keep and store an extra CSF sample if further specific investigations are indicated [ 10, 20]. Viral cultures nowadays play an inferior role in the identification of the viruses, because they are costly and have a low yield [ 20]. They are still used to serotype enteroviruses [ 20].
